page.title: 13Thirsk Athletic Club
page.content: This is a thriving club with 400 members. It was formed in l85l and is the oldest in Yorkshire. Sports activities where the club competes at league level, include badminton (played in Sowerby Parish Hall),bowls cricket, darts, dominoes, hockey, squash and tennis. Ladies county and men's minor counties cricket matches are held here as well as ladies county and territorial hockey games. The new club house was built last winter at a cost of Â£ 9O OOO and comprises bar, kitchen, dancefloor and changing rooms. Four years ago, two all-weather surface tennis courts cost Â£ l2OOO. They also have 6 grass tennis courts. Thomas Lord who established the Lords cricket ground in London was born in Thirsk in l755. A plaque was presented to the club by the MCC on the bicentenary of his birth.
